poem:
Title: The Embers of Empire 

LED bulbs twinkle,
in lost palaces' shadows,
Spanish swords – fallen leaves.
Within ivy cradles, ruins speak,
Of a world shattered, undone.
Rehearsals echo in the murmurs,
of Potsdam's twilight.
Green leaves peek through crumbled stones,
whispering – it's time,
for the undergrowth to conquer, 
in the final act of twilight's play,
where neglected earth reclaims the story.
